title: Pay growth set to slow next year as uncertainty grips companies
text:
The revival in Britons’ pay packets is set to lose steam next year as wage growth slows, new figures warned today.

Pay analyst XpertHR’s survey of settlements at firms employing 150,000 staff found employers expect to increase salaries at an average of 2.1pc over the next 12 months, down from 2.5pc over the past year.

This would only be just ahead of inflation, which currently stands at 1.7pc according to the consumer prices index – meaning families' spending power would grow more slowly in coming months.
